channel.title: aside on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in aside on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: Give it five minutes
item.description: “Learning to think first rather than react quick is a life long pursuit.

item.title: Exactly Once Delivery
item.description: At Remind I helped build the announcement and chat message delivery platform.

item.title: Most Popular Erroneous Post
item.description: There are a few posts on my site that get the lion’s share of traffic.

item.title: The Meta Project Stack
item.description: I guess I’m not the only one who gets distracted by meta projects , although Dave’s appear to actually be productive tangents.

item.title: We called it “magic”
item.description: Just under ten years ago I started working at Canterbury School doing a variety of things.

item.title: Co-working In the Chronicle
item.description: Two and a half years after I mentioned it , six months after we almost made a go of it at the coffee shop in Fort Wayne, co-working is in today’s San Francisco Chronicle .

item.title: Modern Wilde
item.description: Cat and Girl is always good, but this one is absolutely amazing.

item.title: Passing the buck
item.description: Let’s say, just hypothetically, of course, that one day your laptop, which is less than six months old, suddenly has multiple failures: the backlight, optical drive and touch pad all die.

item.title: Get Out!
item.description: Today is National Coming Out Day.

item.title: Web 2.0…
item.description: Struggle as you may to define Web 2.

item.title: Geeks + Booze
item.description: If you’re a geek in the Fort Wayne area, join us on Monday, October 2, 2006, for the first booze-enabled Geek Dinner .

item.title: Hometown Pride
item.description: My hometown, Bluffton, Indiana , is featured in today’s USA Today .

item.title: Overheard
item.description: After OSCON last week I’m in San Francisco, getting some face time with the rest of the Creative Commons staff.

item.title: And this suprises whom?
item.description: Since I’m traveling for two weeks and won’t get my hair did while on the road, I also won’t get my fix of People Magazine (and Teen People, natch).

item.title: Subversion Cheat Sheet
item.description: Since SourceForge started providing Subversion for source control, I’ve suddenly found myself in a world where none of the old CVS knowledge matters any more.

item.title: On my way…
item.description: So I spent last week in sunny Key West for a post-graduation, much needed vacation.

item.title: “Live from Tex-ass”
item.description: Once again I’m late to the party, but I’ve been listening to Sufjan Stevens’ excellent `Come on feel the Illinoise http://en.

item.title: Summer of Code 2006
item.description: Creative Commons is participating in the 2006 Google Summer of Code .

item.title: MozCC Resources Moved
item.description: MozCC will be getting some much-needed attention this summer (wink, wink, nudge, nudge), so I took the opportunity to move the web content from my web server over to Creative Commons’ server.

item.title: My PyCon talk in 5 minutes
item.description: My Senior Capstone Design Project professor asked me to give an abridged version of my PyCon talk, Extensible Desktop Applications with Zope 3 , to our class tomorrow.

item.title: Yes, but who’s writing the check?
item.description: I’m in my last semester of undergraduate work, and between a full time school load and full time work load, some things fall through the cracks.

item.title: ccPublisher 2 Beta now available
item.description: ccPublisher 2 Beta 2 is now available .

item.title: PyCon paper, slides online
item.description: My slides and paper from PyCon 2006 are now online.

item.title: new python.org launched
item.description: After teasing us with screenshots at PyCon 2005, the new python.

item.title: Helping Myself
item.description: I was looking at what it’s going to take to do i18n for ccPublisher this morning, so I searched for wxPython i18n xrc.

item.title: Happy VD
item.description: Am I the only one who’s noticed that “Valentine’s Day” and veneral disease have the same initials?

item.title: CC Internships
item.description: As promised to some readers, here’s your official notice: the call for CC Summer Interns is now up .

item.title: Pedro + PyCon = A Good Week
item.description: So yet another reason to be excited about PyCon coming up at the end of the month: I just snagged tickets to see Pedro The Lion while I’m in Dallas.

item.title: wtf?
item.description: I went to Panera Bread for a bagel and some tea this morning, and took my laptop along to check email adn get started on some work for the day.

item.title: One Step Forward, Two Steps Back
item.description: I had dinner with my grandfather last night.

item.title: Purdue Talk Slides Available
item.description: Slides from my Purdue Talk are available .

item.title: Debugging XUL and Javascript
item.description: Firebug is a wicked cool extension for Firefox which rolls the Javascript console, DOM Inspector and logging console all into one.

item.title: mozCC on addons.mozilla.org
item.description: mozCC is now hosted over at addons.

item.title: Sign me up!
item.description: Well when you put it that way , who wouldn’t want the job?

item.title: mozCC updated, adds support for Flock
item.description: Yeah, an upgrade for mozCC .

item.title: Now with Vitamin K2
item.description: So I’m using K2 on TLOA now… we’ll see how it goes.
